overview: The CSS defines the foundational design system and layout utilities for a healthcare digital experience frontend. It includes resets, typography, color tokens, spacing, grid systems, accessibility utilities, and theme variables for light and dark modes.
interactions: Responsive grid adjustments at 640px, 768px, and 1024px breakpoints
routes: No explicit routes defined; CSS applies globally across all pages
data_flow: Design tokens cascade from :root to components
Theme variables overridden when [data-theme='dark'] is active
Responsive grid templates adjust based on viewport width
accessibility: Smooth scroll behavior for better navigation experience
analytics: No analytics hooks present in CSS; tracking expected at JS layer
test_ideas: Verify .skip-link becomes visible and focusable via keyboard tabbing
Validate dark theme variable overrides when [data-theme='dark'] is toggled
Check responsive grid layouts at defined breakpoints
Ensure all text elements inherit correct typography tokens
Confirm visually hidden elements remain accessible to screen readers
Test color contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards
Validate container max-width and padding across viewport sizes
